content: swan bookmarker pattern original design by kathryn a white bookmarker measures 9 inches materials thread size 10 cotton thread hook size 7 or 1 65mm misc a size i hook and a steel crochet hook any size used to create the rings padding cord = small amount of thread cut seperate from the ball of thread about 3 foot should give you plenty abbreviations chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet treble_crochet = treble_crochet cluster = cluster stitch p = picot skip = skip st = stitch lp = loop space = space round = round increase = increase repeat = repeat = repeat between as indicated * repeat from as indicated special stitches popcorn ring = padding cord ring this ring is made by wrapping your padding cord around the non working end of a crochet hook normally 8-10 times is sufficient cut off excess thread leaving about 1 inch tail gently slide off and insert hook with your working thread into ring draw thread through and single_crochet in ring follow instructions for the number of single_crochet in ring hint do not wrap it to tightly or you will have trouble sliding it off the hook and retaining its shape making these rings takes a little practice but gets easier as you go along swan bookmarker to begin the swan you will wrap the cut piece of thread
